required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Systematic Evaluation of Patients Treated With Stroke Devices for Acute Ischemic Stroke (STRATIS) Registry
clinical_study.official_title: Systematic Evaluation of Patients Treated With Stroke Devices for Acute Ischemic Stroke (STRATIS) Registry

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this registry is to assess clinical outcomes, and different factors that may affect these clinical outcomes such as systems of care, associated with the use of Covidien market-released neurothrombectomy devices intended to restore blood flow in patients experiencing acute ischemic stroke due to large intracranial vessel occlusion.

detailed_description.textblock: This is a prospective, multi-center, non-randomized, observational registry of acute ischemic stroke patients that have or will undergo treatment with the use of a Covidien market-released neurothrombectomy device (as the initial device used to remove the thrombus) within 8 hours of stroke symptom onset, at the discretion of the investigator and independent of participation in this registry. This registry may enroll up to 1000 patients.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants Assessed for Revascularization With mTICI Grades 2b-3
primary_outcome.time_frame: Day 0-At the completion of the thrombectomy procedure
primary_outcome.description: Assess revascularization using modified Thrombolysis in Cerebral Infarction (mTICI) score at the end of the procedure. This scale determines the response of therapy for ischemic stroke based on angiographic appearances of the treated occluded vessel and the distal branches. Classification: grade 0: no perfusion grade 1: antegrade reperfusion past the initial occlusion, but limited distal branch filling with little or slow distal reperfusion grade 2a: antegrade reperfusion of less than half of the occluded target artery previously ischemic territory grade 2b: antegrade reperfusion of more than half of the previously occluded target artery ischemic territory grade 3: complete antegrade reperfusion of the previously occluded target artery ischemic territory, with absence of visualized occlusion in all distal branches (higher values represent better outcomes)

secondary_outcome.measure: Incidence of Neurological Events of Interest
secondary_outcome.time_frame: up to 90 days post index procedure
secondary_outcome.description: Evaluate events causing neurological deterioration (defined as ≥ 4 worsening points from baseline on the NIHSS scale)

other_outcome.time_frame: up to 90 days post index procedure

other_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Good Functional Outcome (mRS 0-2)
other_outcome.description: Score based on modified Rankin Scale (mRS). The modified Rankin Scale (mRS) is a scale used to measure the degree of disability or dependence in daily activities of people who has had a stroke. Clasiffication: 0 - No symptoms. - No significant disability. Able to carry out all usual activities, despite some symptoms. - Slight disability. Able to look after own affairs without assistance, but unable to carry out all previous activities. - Moderate disability. Requires some help, but able to walk unassisted. - Moderately severe disability. Unable to attend to own bodily needs without assistance, and unable to walk unassisted. - Severe disability. Requires constant nursing care and attention, bedridden, incontinent. - Dead. (lower values represent less disability)

other_outcome.measure: Incidence of Device Related Serious Adverse Events
other_outcome.time_frame: up to 90 days post index procedure
other_outcome.description: Any device-related serious adverse events associated with the use of a Covidien/Medtronic market-released neurothrombectomy device during the index stroke procedure up to 90 days post index stroke procedure.

other_outcome.time_frame: Day 0-At the completion of the thrombectomy procedure
other_outcome.description: Arterial access puncture to revascularization measured in minutes. Lower values indicate shorter time to revascularization and vice versa.

other_outcome.measure: Incidence of Procedure Related Serious Adverse Events
other_outcome.time_frame: up to 90 days post index procedure
other_outcome.description: Any procedure related serious adverse events occurring upon insertion of a Covidien/Medtronic market-released neurothrombectomy device during the index stroke procedure up to 90 days post index stroke procedure.

arm_group.description: Patients experiencing an acute ischemic stroke due to a large vessel occlusion treated with a Medtronic Neurovascular market-released neurothrombectomy device.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patient or patient's legally authorized representative has given Informed Consent according to Good Clinical Practices (GCP) and/or IRB and/or local or institutional policies.
- Patient has experienced an acute ischemic stroke due to large intracranial vessel occlusion (with associated symptoms) and has been or will be treated with a Covidien market-released neurothrombectomy device, as the initial device used to remove the thrombus.
- Treatment within 8 hours of stroke onset.
- Pre-Stroke Modified Rankin Scale (mRS) score ≤ 1 (immediately) prior to stroke onset.
- Pre-treatment National Institutes of Health Stroke Scale (NIHSS) ≥ 8 and ≤ 30.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Concurrent participation in a multicenter randomized study.

facility.name: Mercy San Juan Medical Center/ Mercy General
University of Massachusetts Memorial Medical Center
St. Luke's Hospital of Kansas City
Oregon Health and Science University Hospital

patient_data.ipd_description: Only multi center data will be available

measure.title: Race and Ethnicity Not Collected
measure.population: Race and Ethnicity were not collected from any participant.

outcome.title: Number of Participants Assessed for Revascularization With mTICI Grades 2b-3
outcome.description: Assess revascularization using modified Thrombolysis in Cerebral Infarction (mTICI) score at the end of the procedure. This scale determines the response of therapy for ischemic stroke based on angiographic appearances of the treated occluded vessel and the distal branches. Classification: grade 0: no perfusion grade 1: antegrade reperfusion past the initial occlusion, but limited distal branch filling with little or slow distal reperfusion grade 2a: antegrade reperfusion of less than half of the occluded target artery previously ischemic territory grade 2b: antegrade reperfusion of more than half of the previously occluded target artery ischemic territory grade 3: complete antegrade reperfusion of the previously occluded target artery ischemic territory, with absence of visualized occlusion in all distal branches (higher values represent better outcomes)

group.title: Successful Revascularization
group.description: Successful reperfusion (mTICI 2b-3) per imaging core lab

outcome.description: Evaluate events causing neurological deterioration (defined as ≥ 4 worsening points from baseline on the NIHSS scale)
outcome.time_frame: up to 90 days post index procedure

group.title: Neurological Deterioration
group.description: Neurological Deterioration up to 90 days (any event causing neurological deterioration; defined as ≥ 4 points worsening from baseline on the NIHSS scale).

measure.title: Incidence of Neurological Events of Interest
measure.description: Evaluate events causing neurological deterioration (defined as ≥ 4 worsening points from baseline on the NIHSS scale)

outcome.time_frame: up to 90 days post index procedure

group.title: All-cause Mortality
group.description: All cause mortality up to 90 days post index stroke procedure

outcome.description: Score based on modified Rankin Scale (mRS). The modified Rankin Scale (mRS) is a scale used to measure the degree of disability or dependence in daily activities of people who has had a stroke. Clasiffication: 0 - No symptoms. - No significant disability. Able to carry out all usual activities, despite some symptoms. - Slight disability. Able to look after own affairs without assistance, but unable to carry out all previous activities. - Moderate disability. Requires some help, but able to walk unassisted. - Moderately severe disability. Unable to attend to own bodily needs without assistance, and unable to walk unassisted. - Severe disability. Requires constant nursing care and attention, bedridden, incontinent. - Dead. (lower values represent less disability)

outcome.title: Incidence of Device Related Serious Adverse Events
outcome.description: Any device-related serious adverse events associated with the use of a Covidien/Medtronic market-released neurothrombectomy device during the index stroke procedure up to 90 days post index stroke procedure.
outcome.time_frame: up to 90 days post index procedure

group.title: Study Device-related SAEs (Site Reported)

reported_events.time_frame: Up to 90 days post index stroke procedure
reported_events.desc: Per protocol SAEs were collected up to 90 days post index stroke procedure: all-cause mortality, device-related SAE associated with the use of Covidien/Medtronic market-released neurothrombectomy device during the index stroke procedure and procedure related SAE occurring upon insertion of Covidien/Medtronic market-released neurothrombectomy device during the index stroke procedure. Non-SAEs were not required to be collected per protocol.

group.title: Adverse Events
group.description: Serious adverse events reported per protocol during the study

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: Researchers may Publish their individual site experience, but Sponsor reserves the exclusive right to Publish (or coordinate the Publication of) the complete accumulated results of the Registry, and to establish authorship criteria for such Publications for the Registry group based on Registry conduct and compliance, contribution to the Registry’s design, management or enrollment and willingness to accept the rights and responsibilities of an author.
